CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 4a-n,8 Main chain donor - acceptor alternating conjugated polymers with 9,9-dialkylfluorene as donor unit and benzothiadiazole as acceptor unit have been extensively studied as donor components in BHJ PSCs. 9 PCE of polymer solar cells based on 9,9-dialkylfluorene moieties has been improved to 4.5% with an open circuit voltage ( V oc ) of almost 1 V. 10 Compared with the large number of publications on 9,9dialkylfluorene based D-A alternating copolymers applied in PSCs , less attention was paid to spirobifluorene - based copolymers. In the past few years , spirobifluorene has been used as an ideal building block in construction of stable blue light - emitting materials. 11 In the spiro - annulated molecules , the two perpendicular conjugated moieties are connected with the sp 3 -hybridized carbon atom as the spiro center. This structural feature can minimize the extravagant aggregation of polymers containing spiro - annulated molecules and thus can improve their solubility and processability. 11,12 Furthermore , the spirobifluorene structure can prevent the possible photo / thermal oxidation of the 9-position of the fluorene unit to form the undesired low energy ketonic defect. 13 In theory , stable polymer structures are beneficial for the long lifetime of polymer solar cells. Here , we demonstrate for the first time that spirobifluorene can be a very useful building block to construct main chain donor - acceptor alternating conjugated polymer , poly[2,7-(3′,6′-dioctyloxy)-9,9′-spirobifluorene-alt-5,5-(4′,7′-di-2-thienyl-5′,6′-dioctyloxy-2′,1′,3′-benzothiadiazole)] ( PSFDTBT ) as shown in Scheme 1 , for high efficiency polymer solar cells. The octyloxy chains on spirobifluorene and 2′,1′,3′-benzothiadiazole units can provide PSFDTBT with good solubility in common organic solvents. The transport properties of the polymer are investigated by fabricating organic thin film field - effect transistors ( OFETs ). The pristine PSFDTBT film spin - cast from DCB solution exhibited hole mobility of 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 with on / off ratios in the order of 10^5 . The PSFDTBT / PC71BM blend films show hole mobility of 1.14 × 10^-2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 and an electron mobility of 2.7 × 10^-4 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 . Under simulated solar illumination of AM 1.5G ( 100 mW / cm^2 ) , a PCE of 4.6% has been achieved for PSCs composed of PSFDTBT and PC71BM as the active layer in simply processed devices. The devices illustrate a considerably high V oc of 0.94 V , a J sc of 8.0 mA / cm^2 , and a comparable fill factor ( FF ) of 0.60. All device measurements were conducted in air without any encapsulation. Noticeably , PSFDTBT exhibits significantly improved PSC performance when compares with the analogous 9,9-dialkyl-9H-fluorene based polymer P1 ( Scheme 1 ) , which showed general PSC performance with PCE of about 3.1% in our previous report.

Let's think step by step.

Sure, I'd be happy to help you identify the "Material Name" entities in the paragraph!

1. "4a-n,8 Main chain donor - acceptor alternating conjugated polymers" - This is a Material Name entity, as it refers to a specific type of polymer material.
2. "9,9-dialkylfluorene" - This is a Material Name entity, as it refers to a specific type of molecule used in the polymer material.
3. "benzothiadiazole" - This is a Material Name entity, as it refers to a specific type of molecule used in the polymer material.
4. "PSFDTBT" - This is a Material Name entity, as it refers to a specific type of polymer material composed of spirobifluorene and other molecules.
5. "PC71BM" - This is a Material Name entity, as it refers to a specific type of molecule used in the polymer material.

In summary, the Material Name entities in the paragraph are:

* "4a-n,8 Main chain donor - acceptor alternating conjugated polymers"
* "9,9-dialkylfluorene"
* "benzothiadiazole"
* "PSFDTBT"
* "PC71BM"
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Of course! Here are the Material Name entities in the paragraph:

1. "PSFDTBT" - This is a Material Name entity, as it refers to a specific type of polymer material composed of spirobifluorene and other molecules.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the Material Name entities in the paragraph presented as a Markdown table:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PSFDTBT |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any other questions.

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 4a-n,8 Main chain donor - acceptor alternating conjugated polymers with 9,9-dialkylfluorene as donor unit and benzothiadiazole as acceptor unit have been extensively studied as donor components in BHJ PSCs. 9 PCE of polymer solar cells based on 9,9-dialkylfluorene moieties has been improved to 4.5% with an open circuit voltage ( V oc ) of almost 1 V. 10 Compared with the large number of publications on 9,9dialkylfluorene based D-A alternating copolymers applied in PSCs , less attention was paid to spirobifluorene - based copolymers. In the past few years , spirobifluorene has been used as an ideal building block in construction of stable blue light - emitting materials. 11 In the spiro - annulated molecules , the two perpendicular conjugated moieties are connected with the sp 3 -hybridized carbon atom as the spiro center. This structural feature can minimize the extravagant aggregation of polymers containing spiro - annulated molecules and thus can improve their solubility and processability. 11,12 Furthermore , the spirobifluorene structure can prevent the possible photo / thermal oxidation of the 9-position of the fluorene unit to form the undesired low energy ketonic defect. 13 In theory , stable polymer structures are beneficial for the long lifetime of polymer solar cells. Here , we demonstrate for the first time that spirobifluorene can be a very useful building block to construct main chain donor - acceptor alternating conjugated polymer , poly[2,7-(3′,6′-dioctyloxy)-9,9′-spirobifluorene-alt-5,5-(4′,7′-di-2-thienyl-5′,6′-dioctyloxy-2′,1′,3′-benzothiadiazole)] ( PSFDTBT ) as shown in Scheme 1 , for high efficiency polymer solar cells. The octyloxy chains on spirobifluorene and 2′,1′,3′-benzothiadiazole units can provide PSFDTBT with good solubility in common organic solvents. The transport properties of the polymer are investigated by fabricating organic thin film field - effect transistors ( OFETs ). The pristine PSFDTBT film spin - cast from DCB solution exhibited hole mobility of 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 with on / off ratios in the order of 10^5 . The PSFDTBT / PC71BM blend films show hole mobility of 1.14 × 10^-2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 and an electron mobility of 2.7 × 10^-4 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 . Under simulated solar illumination of AM 1.5G ( 100 mW / cm^2 ) , a PCE of 4.6% has been achieved for PSCs composed of PSFDTBT and PC71BM as the active layer in simply processed devices. The devices illustrate a considerably high V oc of 0.94 V , a J sc of 8.0 mA / cm^2 , and a comparable fill factor ( FF ) of 0.60. All device measurements were conducted in air without any encapsulation. Noticeably , PSFDTBT exhibits significantly improved PSC performance when compares with the analogous 9,9-dialkyl-9H-fluorene based polymer P1 ( Scheme 1 ) , which showed general PSC performance with PCE of about 3.1% in our previous report.

Let's think step by step.

Sure, I'd be happy to help you identify the property names of the materials mentioned in the paragraph! Here are the materials mentioned in the paragraph, along with their property names:

1. 9,9-dialkylfluorene: Donor unit
2. Benzothiadiazole: Acceptor unit
3. Spirobifluorene: Building block
4. PSFDTBT (Poly[2,7-(3′,6′-dioctyloxy)-9,9′-spirobifluorene-alt-5,5-(4′,7′-di-2-thienyl-5′,6′-dioctyloxy-2′,1′,3′-benzothiadiazole)]): Main chain donor-acceptor alternating conjugated polymer
5. PC71BM (7,7,8,8,9-pentaphenyl-5,5-disulfide): Active layer in polymer solar cells
6. OFETs (Organic thin film field-effect transistors): Device fabricated using the PSFDTBT polymer
7. PCE (Power conversion efficiency): Efficiency of the polymer solar cells
8. V oc (Open circuit voltage): Maximum voltage achieved by the solar cells
9. J sc (Short circuit current density): Current density at the short circuit point of the solar cells
10. FF (Fill factor): Ratio of the active area of the solar cells to the total area of the device

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

Sure, here are the entities that clearly refer to the property name of a material in the provided text:

1. 9,9-dialkylfluorene
2. Benzothiadiazole
3. PSFDTBT (Poly[2,7-(3′,6′-dioctyloxy)-9,9′-spirobifluorene-alt-5,5-(4′,7′-di-2-thienyl-5′,6′-dioctyloxy-2′,1′,3′-benzothiadiazole)]

These are the only entities in the text that refer directly to the property name of a material.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph, presented as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name":

| Property Name |
| --- |
| 9,9-dialkylfluorene |
| Benzothiadiazole |
| PSFDTBT (Poly[2,7-(3′,6′-dioctyloxy)-9,9′-spirobifluorene-alt-5,5-(4′,7′-di-2-thienyl-5′,6′-dioctyloxy-2′,1′,3′-benzothiadiazole)] |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 4a-n,8 Main chain donor - acceptor alternating conjugated polymers with 9,9-dialkylfluorene as donor unit and benzothiadiazole as acceptor unit have been extensively studied as donor components in BHJ PSCs. 9 PCE of polymer solar cells based on 9,9-dialkylfluorene moieties has been improved to 4.5% with an open circuit voltage ( V oc ) of almost 1 V. 10 Compared with the large number of publications on 9,9dialkylfluorene based D-A alternating copolymers applied in PSCs , less attention was paid to spirobifluorene - based copolymers. In the past few years , spirobifluorene has been used as an ideal building block in construction of stable blue light - emitting materials. 11 In the spiro - annulated molecules , the two perpendicular conjugated moieties are connected with the sp 3 -hybridized carbon atom as the spiro center. This structural feature can minimize the extravagant aggregation of polymers containing spiro - annulated molecules and thus can improve their solubility and processability. 11,12 Furthermore , the spirobifluorene structure can prevent the possible photo / thermal oxidation of the 9-position of the fluorene unit to form the undesired low energy ketonic defect. 13 In theory , stable polymer structures are beneficial for the long lifetime of polymer solar cells. Here , we demonstrate for the first time that spirobifluorene can be a very useful building block to construct main chain donor - acceptor alternating conjugated polymer , poly[2,7-(3′,6′-dioctyloxy)-9,9′-spirobifluorene-alt-5,5-(4′,7′-di-2-thienyl-5′,6′-dioctyloxy-2′,1′,3′-benzothiadiazole)] ( PSFDTBT ) as shown in Scheme 1 , for high efficiency polymer solar cells. The octyloxy chains on spirobifluorene and 2′,1′,3′-benzothiadiazole units can provide PSFDTBT with good solubility in common organic solvents. The transport properties of the polymer are investigated by fabricating organic thin film field - effect transistors ( OFETs ). The pristine PSFDTBT film spin - cast from DCB solution exhibited hole mobility of 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 with on / off ratios in the order of 10^5 . The PSFDTBT / PC71BM blend films show hole mobility of 1.14 × 10^-2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 and an electron mobility of 2.7 × 10^-4 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 . Under simulated solar illumination of AM 1.5G ( 100 mW / cm^2 ) , a PCE of 4.6% has been achieved for PSCs composed of PSFDTBT and PC71BM as the active layer in simply processed devices. The devices illustrate a considerably high V oc of 0.94 V , a J sc of 8.0 mA / cm^2 , and a comparable fill factor ( FF ) of 0.60. All device measurements were conducted in air without any encapsulation. Noticeably , PSFDTBT exhibits significantly improved PSC performance when compares with the analogous 9,9-dialkyl-9H-fluorene based polymer P1 ( Scheme 1 ) , which showed general PSC performance with PCE of about 3.1% in our previous report.

Let's think step by step.

Sure, I'd be happy to help you identify the values of the material properties mentioned in the paragraph! Here are the values mentioned in the paragraph:

1. Number of the donor unit: 9
2. Number of the acceptor unit: 1
3. Number of the conjugated polymers: 4a-n
4. Number of the main chain: 8
5. Value of the PCE (percentage conversion efficiency) of polymer solar cells: 4.5%
6. Value of the open circuit voltage (V oc) of polymer solar cells: almost 1 V
7. Value of the number of publications on 9,9-dialkylfluorene based D-A alternating copolymers applied in PSCs: less attention was paid
8. Value of the ideal building block in construction of stable blue light-emitting materials: spirobifluorene
9. Value of the structural feature that can minimize the extravagant aggregation of polymers containing spiro-annulated molecules: sp 3 -hybridized carbon atom as the spiro center
10. Value of the possible photo / thermal oxidation of the 9-position of the fluorene unit: undesired low energy ketonic defect
11. Value of the stable polymer structures that are beneficial for the long lifetime of polymer solar cells: PSFDTBT
12. Value of the number of the octyloxy chains on spirobifluorene and 2',1',3'-benzothiadiazole units: 8
13. Value of the good solubility of PSFDTBT in common organic solvents: good solubility
14. Value of the transport properties of the polymer investigated by fabricating organic thin film field - effect transistors ( OFETs ):
 * Hole mobility of pristine PSFDTBT film spin - cast from DCB solution: 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V -1 s^-1
 * Hole mobility of PSFDTBT / PC71BM blend films: 1.14 × 10^-2 cm^2 V -1 s^-1
 * Electron mobility of PSFDTBT / PC71BM blend films: 2.7 × 10^-4 cm^2 V -1 s^-1
 * PCE of PSCs composed of PSFDTBT and PC71BM as the active layer in simply processed devices: 4.6%
 * Value of the considerably high V oc of PSCs composed of PSFDTBT and PC71BM: 0.94 V
 * Value of the J sc of PSCs composed of PSFDTBT and PC71BM: 8.0 mA / cm^2
 * Value of the comparable fill factor (FF) of PSCs composed of PSFDTBT and PC71BM: 0.60

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
